Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First I need to look at each cases timeline The total resolution time is from Receive Ticket to Close Ticket Let me list out each cases start and end times to calculate the duration Starting with Case 101 The receive time is 20240301 0800 and close is 1015 the same day So thats 2 hours and 15 minutes That seems pretty quick Case 102 Received at 0805 on the 1st and closed at 0915 on the 2nd Lets see from 0805 to 0815 next day would be 24 hours and 10 minutes Wait but the close is on the 2nd at 0915 so total is 25 hours and 10 minutes Thats way longer than 101 Case 103 Received at 0810 on the 1st closed at 0930 the same day Lets calculate that From 0810 to 0930 is 1 hour 20 minutes Very quick Case 104 Received at 0820 on the 1st closed at 0830 on the 2nd So thats about 24 hours and 10 minutes Hmm similar to 102 Case 105 Received at 0825 on the 1st closed at 0930 on the 3rd Thats over two days Let me compute that From March 1st 0825 to March 3rd 0930 Thats 49 hours and 5 minutes Thats way longer than the others So looking at the total durations 101 2h15m 102 25h10m 103 1h20m 104 24h10m 105 49h5m Comparing these cases 102 104 and especially 105 are taking way longer than 101 and 103 So the significantly longer ones are 102 104 105 The average of the others is maybe around 2 hours so those three are outliers

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now to find out why Lets look at each of these cases in detail Starting with Case 102 Activities Receive 805 Triage 830 thats 25 minutes Then assign to Level1 at 900 which is 30 minutes after triage Then investigate starts at 1130 Wait no between assign and investigate Assign at 900 then next activity is escalate to Level2 at 1130 Wait so between Assign and Escalate theres a gap Let me check the log again for case 102 Looking at the table for case 102 After Assign to Level1 Agent at 900 the next event is Escalate to Level2 at 1130 So between 900 and 1130 thats 25 hours Why the escalation Maybe the Level1 couldnt handle it so they escalated The investigation after escalation is at 1400 2 PM Wait the escalate step was at 1130 then investigation by Level2 starts at 1400 So between escalate and investigate is 25 hours Then the investigation takes until 1400 then resolve the next day at 900 So the investigate to resolve is 18 hours Wait lets parse the timeline again for case 102 Case 102 805 Receive 830 Triage 25 mins 900 Assign to Level1 30 mins after triage Then until escalate is 25 hours from 900 to 1130 So from assign to escalate 25 hours Maybe the Level1 agent took a long time before escalating Then after escalation the investigation starts at 1400 3 hours later Maybe waiting for Level2 to pick it up Then investigation ends when The next step after investigation is at 1400 investigate issue then resolve at 900 next day So from 1400 to 900 next day is 19 hours Thats a long time Hmm So the problem here might be the time between escalate and investigate but actually the investigation to resolve is taking a day Maybe the Level2 team is slow Or theres a delay after investigation

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So the main issues seem to be 1 Long delays after escalation particularly in cases where the Level2 team takes too long to start working on the ticket like case 105s 28h delay between escalate and Level2s investigation 2 Also after investigation the resolve step is taking too long Like in case 102 and 104 the time between investigation and resolve is overnight Maybe the agents are not working during offhours so the clock stops Or maybe they need to work during the next day Wait but the total time is counted including overnights The problem states cycle times so including all time even if its after business hours So maybe the Level2 team is slow to take action after escalation especially in case 105 Looking at the activities Another possible factor is the number of escalations Cases 102 104 105 have escalations Maybe escalated cases take longer Lets see Looking at the cases Case 101 No escalation resolves quickly Case 103 No escalation resolves quickly Cases with escalation 102 104 105 are the slow ones So escalations might be a contributing factor but not the only one Because even among escalated cases 102 and 104 have 2425 hours but case 105 is way longer

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now the problem is to find the root causes So for cases 102 104 and especially 105 the main issues are long waits after escalation or between steps Looking at Case 102 After escalate at 1130 on 1st next step is investigate at 1400 25 hours later Then from investigate 1400 to resolve next day at 900 is 19 hours Thats a long delay between investigation and resolve Case 104 After investigate at 1300 on 1st March next is resolve on the 2nd at 800 So from 1300 to next day 800 is 19 hours Same as 102 Case 105s big delays are after escalate So perhaps when a ticket is escalated theres a delay before the Level2 team picks it up Like after escalate the Level2 might not start the investigation immediately In case 102 the escalate to investigate is 25 hours Maybe thats okay but in case 105 its 28 hours Thats a big issue Another possible cause is that after investigation the resolve step is taking too long For 102 and 104 the time between investigation and resolve is overnight Maybe the agents are not working during offhours so the clock stops Or maybe they need to work during the next day Wait but the total time is counted including overnights The problem states cycle times so including all time even if its after business hours So maybe the Level2 team is slow to take action after escalation especially in case 105 Another possible point is the time between assigning to before escalating Wait in case 105 assigned to Level1 at 900 on March 1st then investigate starts at 910 just 10 minutes after assign then escalate at 1000 50 minutes later So the Level1 agent tried to investigate but couldnt so escalated But the time between escalate and the next investigation Level2 is 28 hours Thats a big gap So the main issues seem to be 1 Long delays after escalation take action after escalation especially in case 105

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: So the root causes could be 1 Delay in the Level2 team responding to escalated tickets In case 105 it took 28 hours between escalation and the Level2 starting work on it Thats a big issue 2 The time between investigation and resolution is overnight which might be due to the team not working outside business hours However if the investigation to resolve takes 19 hours thats a day so maybe the Level2 team is only working during the day so the ticket is left overnight leading to that delay But thats a structural issue if they cant work outside hours Alternatively maybe after investigation business hours However if the investigation to resolve takes 19 hours thats a day so maybe the Level2 team is only working during the day so the ticket is left overnight leading to that delay But Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So to sum up the factors causing delays are 1 Long delays between escalation and the Level2 team starting work eg case 105s 28h delay between escalate and Level2s investigation 2 Overnight delays between investigation and resolution when the team is not available leading to overnight delays like 19 hours between investigation and resolve in case 102 and 104 3 Possibly the time between investigation and resolve is too long even during active hours Additionally in case 105 after escalate to Level2 the next investigate is on the same day Wait no case 105s escalate is on 1st at 1000 then next activity is investigate on 2nd 1400 Thats a day and a half Thats a big delay in Level2s response So the root causes are likely Delays in the Level2 team addressing escalated tickets eg 28 hours in case 105 Overnight delays between investigation and resolution because the team isnt working during nights Maybe the Level2 team is overburdened or slow in starting their part Additionally in case 105 after escalate to Level2 the investigation by Level2 is delayed So the Level2 team isnt getting to the ticket quickly Another point the number of steps For example case 105 had an escalate then after escalate they have to investigate again adding more steps But the time is the key So the main factors are Escalation handling significant delays in when Level2 starts working on the ticket after escalation Overnight delays nonbusiness hours causing extended resolution times Additionally maybe the time between assign and escalate is too long but in case 105 the escalate was only 50 minutes after assigning assigned at 900 escalate at 1000 So thats okay Other possible factors Maybe some steps have long waiting times between activities For example in case 105 after escalate 1000 on 1st to the next step investigate on 2nd 1400 is 28 hours Thats the key issue So recommendations would be to ensure that escalated tickets are addressed quickly by Level2 maybe better escalation processes or more resources for Level2 Also maybe afterhours coverage to reduce overnight delays or better communication between teams to reduce the time between escalate and investigation Another possible cause is that after escalate the ticket sits until the next business day hence the delay For instance if the escalate happens at 1000 on the 1st and the next days investigate is at 1400 that would be 28 hours If the business hours are 85 then after escalate at 1000 maybe the Level2 team is busy and they dont pick it up until the next day So maybe the Level2 team is overworked leading to long queues So to summarize the root causes 1 Delayed response from the Level2 team after escalation eg 28 hours in case 105 2 Overnight delays between investigation and resolution if the process cant proceed outside business hours 3 Possibly after investigation theres a long wait for resolution which could be due to team availability or inefficiency So the recommendations would be to improve Level2s response time maybe by adding more staff better prioritization or better escalation management Also maybe allowing some coverage outside regular hours to reduce overnight delays Also ensuring that when the investigation is done the resolve step is done the same day if possible Also maybe the process could have a better way to track escalated tickets to ensure theyre picked up promptly Another idea Maybe the Level2 team isnt getting the tickets quickly enough after escalation So the key issue is the Level2s responsiveness Another thing In case 105 after the first investigation by Level1 9101000 then escalate then Level2 doesnt pick up for a day and a half Thats a big issue So summarizing Root causes 1 Delay in Level2 teams response to escalated tickets leading to long gaps between escalation and investigation Root cause 2 Overnight delays when the process halts during nonbusiness hours increasing total time Root cause 3 Prolonged delays between investigation and resolution possibly due to team availability or inefficiency Proposals Improve Level2 teams responsiveness by adding staff better prioritization or better communication Implement afterhours coverage or improve scheduling to reduce overnight delays Streamline the process between investigation and resolution to reduce that steps time Also maybe the escalation process itself is slow or theres a backlog in Level2 Another observation Case 105s total time is almost double that of 102 and 104 which also had escalations but 102 and 104 took about 2425 hours while 105 is 49 hours So the 28hour delay between escalate and investigation is the key differentiator So the main factors are the time between escalation and the Level2s action and the overnight delays Therefore the recommendations should address those points
